intro: Allophyllum gilioides, commonly known as the African mountain tea, is a shrub native to the highlands of East Africa. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces red, berry-like fruits that are edible and often consumed by local communities. It thrives in temperate climates and is adapted to rocky, well-drained soils. Allophyllum gilioides is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
